alert.note: Alert for Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 5:28PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Columbia, northern Suwannee and southeastern Hamilton Counties through 600 PM EDT... At 528 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dowling Park, or 10 miles south of Suwannee River State Park, moving northeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph, pea size hail, and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Live Oak, White Springs, Wellborn, Dowling Park, Luraville, Newburn and Houston. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Hamilton; Northern Columbia; Southern Columbia; Suwannee
